content.description: 60 meter or longer rope is required for this line. If you are climbing with a 50 meter rope, feel free to use the mid-route rap station during your descent or break up the climb and practice multi-pitch rope work. Route progressively gets harder as you climb, with the crux near the last few bolts. The darker red rock is usually a sign of water runoff and seasonal drainage so some minor dusting of holds may be required, from time-to-time. Stay on the right side of the red rock near the lighter white rock as you approach the upper crux. Line was bolted by Bill Weishaar using glue-in eye bolts, stainless rap chains and quick clip rap hooks.
content.protection: 14 Bolts plus Top and Mid-route Rap Anchors
content.location: Look for the obvious red section of rock and follow the bolt line that is on the right side, near the lighter white rock. 2 O'Clock Shadow starts just left in a dihedral.

content.description: A long climb with a few challenging sections and clean rock.  A 60 meter rope will work. After getting past the first bolt you have easier climbing and good stances to the 5th bolt where you run into the mid crux. Continue climbing towards the dihedral where the final crux moves are entering and exiting the dihedral.
content.protection: 14 bolts and hooks at the anchors

content.description: Starts just left of the first bolt climb 5.9 for the first four bolts then the business starts. Then 10 ft 5.10a to a good no hands rest to clip from. This is where the first Crux starts. Use a rail out left to get a high reach for a jug and then come back right to a good two hand pocket to clip from. Things let up after the next bolt until you reach the cave and get another great rest. (You could sit up there all day if so inclined.) Once you've rested enough start the second crux
content.location: At the vine wall locate the obvious roof/cave feature about 75' up above the large scooped it section of the wall with a tree stump in the bottom middle of the feature. The start is almost directly below the right of the roof

content.description: Bluff Banter moves a bit back and forth, from side to side, as the line works a path to the anchors below a large cedar tree. The climb starts easy and turns a bit more technical with the more vertical face above. Feel free to stay just right of the bolts or left for a different crux feel 3/4 of the way up the line. Climb past the last bolt for an easier, juggy finish. Rap chains provide an easy rappel.
content.protection: Quick Draws and anchor cleaning protection
content.location:
Worked and cleaned by Amy Reed and Marcus Floyd, this line of bolts is one of the first routes you see on the Vineyard Wall when approaching from the stairs along the base trail.  Hiking southward from the step, head past Bee Hive, then eventually arriving at the south end of Legacy Wall. The Vineyard Wall starts as a protruding slab just 40 ft left of the route Bolts Gone Wild. Head slightly around the slab until the wall begins to appear more vertical. 

 Bluff Banter starts by ascending past a couple bolts to gain a ledge at the base of the main vertical section of the climb. The obvious cedar tree above the route can help with the identification of the start and finish.

content.description: Flat gray slab to a bulge. Hanging slab to the flower petals on the overhanging orchid.
Long  and fun climb with a couple harder sections, one being getting over the small bulge lower on the route, then at mid way going right after the rest on the small ledge.
content.location: Middle of Vineyard Wall 12 ft  right of Excalibur.

content.description: Pull through some easy climbing until you get into the grey scoop in the wall. Pull up on some thin hold to some big moves. Climb over the small overhang to get to a good clipping jug. Get what rest you can here then push until you reach there no hands rest under a small overhang. Pull the overhang then enjoy a victory lap to the chains.
content.location: At Vineyard locate the large scoop in the wall with a large roof feature about 75' up. Locate the tree stump at the bottom of the scoop. Abominable Flowman is the first route to the right of the tree.

content.description: In every choose your own adventure book there's a alternate end.  This is the alternate for Cave of Time.  Start is the same as Cave of Time. When you reach the roof you'll be faced with a choice,  the right path or the left.  If you choose the left, fix to the anchors on the left wall of the cave and bring up your second. Climb out of the cave to find your own path out of the Cave of Time.  Don't try to lead it as a single pitch as a fall above the roof would mean hitting the ledge below due to the amount of rope out. If you're not solid in the grade I suggest fixing to the first bolt of the second pitch to clip the second bolt then lower back into the cave for the start.  The first bolt is only there to prevent a factor 2 fall onto the anchor.
content.location: At vine wall look up to find the obvious large roof feature. Start on Cave of Time. Find the ledge with the tree stump and it the second to the right.

content.description: 60 meter or longer rope is required for this line. If you are climbing with a 50 meter rope, feel free to use the mid-route rap station. Route progressively gets harder as you climb, with the crux near the last few bolts. The darker red rock is usually a sign of water runoff and seasonal drainage so some minor dusting of holds may be required, from time-to-time. Line was bolted by Bill Weishaar using glue-in eye bolts, stainless rap chains and quick clip rap hooks. First ascent goes to Kelly Foster.
content.location: Just left of another tall line known as Sawasdee. Both routes start near each other but Sawasdee (5.8+), the harder of the two, follows the right side of the red section of rock and becomes a bit more vertical towards the top. Start in an obvious dihedral leading up to a large horizontal pocket. Continue up using good sized, block holds until gaining a ledge at the base of the upper, slightly more vertical face.

content.description:
Vineyard Wall: This long vertical scoop shaped wall was covered with vines but now offers a great mix of steep slab, shaded vertical climbing during the summer afternoon, with plenty of winter morning sunlight. On the right, Bluff Banter, is the warm-up climb of choice, or head to the far left to warm up on 2 o'Clock which is nearly twice as tall.

Routes range from 50 ft to 110 ft tall and currently provide a wide range of difficulty levels (range from 5.7 to 5.hard). Work in progress.

Please provide feedback

using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
